instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message:
Small liquid on C6553

When all connected go 19.5V and 2.5A on charger.
No fan spin, no chime, trackpad no clicks.

PPBUS_G3H = 12.56V
PPBUS_HS_CPU = 12.56V
PP3V3_G3H = 3.41V
PPBUS_HS_OTH5V = 12.56V
PPBUS_HS_OTH3V3 = 12.60V
PPBUS_S4_HS_TPAD = 12.60V

PP5V_S5 = 5V
PP5V_S4 = 0V

PP3V3_S5 = 3.32V
PP3V3_SUS = 3.32V
PP3V3_S4 = 0V

PM_SLP_S5_L is missing.

Found a bit of liquid which gone under U1100.
Is there any point of re-hot of U1100?

Any hints?

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message:
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).
If detected, check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L too.

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message:
No pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.
It stays at stable 0.367V.

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message:
It MUST be steady high; unless SMC_ONOFF_L is triggered.
Check R1210...

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message:
R1210/2 = 3.3V
R1210/1 = 0.36V

It got correct resistance 1K Ohms.

Removed shield from J9600 and there was liquid as well and pins 44, 4, 6 looks affected.

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message:
Be sure no corrosion between J1800 pads.

Low level on PM_PWRBTN_L should be caused by SMC, or PCH.
In your case, can be accumulated crap underneath BGA chips, or some corroded, or broken resistor/trace.

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message: It will safe to remove J9600? I think small part is melted).

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message: You will need to bypass it with cables then...

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message:
Cleaned board in ultrasonic cleaner and on both sides of R1210 now got 3.3V

Board boot now but wont charge battery.
It shows 40% of charge so battery is visible by system but wont charge.

PPBUS_G3H without battery = 12.6V
PPBUS_G3H with battery = 11.6V

Is there any way to check if thats issue is on board or it need battery?

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message:
Always best to check with known good battery in such case.
You may waste the time, even cause more damage on MLB, when the culprit is the battery.

threads.title: 820-00281 19.5V 2.5A won't boot
threads.message: All works fine with new battery - again... many many thanks for your help.
